title.narrative: POLICIES, PROGRAMME AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the political and programmatic environment, including coordination, partnership and governance (national and local), is strengthened., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Disaster Risk Reduction, Early Childhood Development, Environmental Sustainability, Evaluation And Research, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,boys and girls aged 0-59 months, adolescents and women (especially those living in the most disadvantaged communities) have access to basic services, use packages of multisectoral high-impact, gender-sensitive interventions (health /HIV, nutrition, WASH) and adopt appropriate behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the political and programmatic environment, including coordination, partnership and governance (national and local), is strengthened.

description.narrative: In 2019, leadership and governance mechanisms were strengthened through the establishment of thematic health groups to monitor the 2015–2024 National Health Development Plan (PNDS in French), the organization of joint integrated supervision of target contracts and the update of national policy documents on community health, HIV/AIDS and nutrition. Joint advocacy and partnership efforts influenced strategic planning and mobilized additional resources for nutrition and community health. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Amount of counterpart funds mobilized by the government for the Water and Sanitation sector

Number of coordination structures set up for the management of COVID 19
Number of policy documents, guidelines on continuity of care in the management of COVID 19 elaborated and disseminated
